2073.subject: GS
2073.descrlong: Examines major themes in World History since 1750. These include the making of the first "modern societies" in Europe, the evolution of globalization, the extension of European imperial control throughout the world and the resistance it generated, the global wars and revolutions of the twentieth century, the rise and decline of communism, the emergence of Third-World nations on the global stage, and the growing role of the USA in world affairs. Designed for students needing sections of World History as described in the K-12 History/Social Science Content Standards. (Offered fall semester.)
